title: Run (cards)
text:
A run, straight or sequence is a combination of <a href="playing%20cards">playing cards</a> where cards have consecutive rank values. They need not normally be of the same suit. However, if they are, this is referred to as a suit sequence. Some games, such as <a href="cribbage">cribbage</a>, specify that an ace counts as one ("ace low"); others specify that an ace counts above a King ("ace high"); yet others, such as <a href="poker">poker</a>, allow an ace to count either high or low.
Runs are one of the two types of <a href="meld%20%28cards%29">meld</a> that may be used in games where melding is part of the play; the other being a <a href="set%20%28cards%29">set</a> or group, such as a pair or triplet.
A natural sequence, as opposed to one that is wild, is one that consists purely of 'natural cards', without any <a href="wild%20card%20%28playing%20card%29">wild cards</a> such as <a href="Joker%20%28playing%20card%29">jokers</a> or <a href="Deuce%20%28playing%20card%29">deuces</a>.
